title: Why so many Koreans have plastic surgery? : r/korea - Reddit
body: While Korea has the highest rate of cosmetic procedures per capita (that's all procedures, invasive and non-invasive) they are only slightly ahead of some other countries, and Korea is known as a cosmetic procedure destination spot. Especially for Chinese and Japanese people. They make up a non-trivial amount of the patients.
readable_content:
- [deleted] (2016-12-22): Try even searching this sub. There is already a bunch of answers available.
But the basic gist is looks are very very important here and affects basically every faucet of society. For e.g In job applications you attach a little photo which people professionally photoshop for you.
Also no teenagers get surgery. And the majority of plastic surgery done here is the double eyelid ones done for females after graduating high school before leaving for university. It's an extremely simple procedure.

- Char_Aznable_Custom (2016-12-22): The amount of surgery people actually get is overblown but even the difference in attitude is very noticeable. It's just not seen as a big deal here. And while I don't personally agree with it I can see the validity of the view point. Basically: if you're dumb, you study; if you're fat, you diet; if you're weak, you lift weights; if you're ugly, you get surgery.
Plastic surgery is just treated like an extension of makeup in the game of making yourself look better.
